title: I.Sicily inscription 004014

support._:
Well-polished stele, chipped along the upper edge of the front face and the bottom-right corner. Before its final reuse, the stele has been used as a gravestone three times. It bears three distinct inscriptions with no connection to each other, whose relative chronology is impossible to establish. 
                                        Two of them have been placed at the two ends of the front face, upside down in relation to one another, conventionally indicated with I (inscriptions a and b). 
                                        The third inscription is on the opposite face, indicated with II. Here we present inscription b of face I. On same support as  and .

provenanceFound._: Discovered in 1952 during the excavation of trench XII (property of the Orpanage of Lipari). It was reused as a cover of tomb 216

repository._: Museo Archeologico Regionale Eoliano "Luigi Bernab� Brea"

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Eoliano "Luigi Bernab� Brea"
museum.description: The enormous collection is displayed in several neighbouring buildings, each with a particular focus: Prehistory, Prehistory of the minor islands, Epigraphy, Geology, the Classical period and later. The finds come from across the Aeolian islands, under the sea that surrounds them, and from the site of Milazzo on Sicily. One of the 3 largest Sicilian collections, it is truly comprehensive in scope and contains a few finds (e.g. the terracotta tragic theatre masks) that are near unique

bibl.title: Meligunìs Lipára. XII. Le iscrizioni lapidarie greche e latine delle isole eolie
bibl.citation: L. Bernabò Brea, M. Cavalier, e L. Campagna, Meligunìs Lipára. XII. Le iscrizioni lapidarie greche e latine delle isole eolie (Palermo: Mario Grispo Editore, 2003)
